text: I had a really hard time trying to come
up with a name for this dish because
what I did was I took a fairly standard
meat pie with ground meat on the bottom
and potatoes on top but then I went
through it and I made every element
better
when I thought about making a meat pie I
thought how can I add even more flavor
so I deconstructed it in my mind and I
put it back together and at each step I
added just a little something special so
for example when it comes to browning
the meat instead of just letting it
Brown in the pan I'm gonna let it get
really dark brown really caramelized and
I'm gonna do it in batches to make sure
that it is golden all over it adds a
little bit of time but it also adds a
ton of flavor here's a trick about how
to brown something so once you get it
evenly distributed in the pan walk away
from the pan don't touch it
hard not to now I'm just gonna cook the
onions right in the drippings and here's
another step where I'm just gonna add
another layer of flavor instead of just
cooking the onions until they soften I'm
gonna caramelize them until they're
really really dark golden brown when the
onions are ready that's when you want to
add your garlic and sage and now I can
just add the meat back to the pan a
typical green vegetable ingredient that
you'd find in a cottage pie or a
shepherd's pie would be frozen peas that
you throw in and those are great but I'm
gonna use spinach instead please don't
absorb creamed spinach 2/3 cream
Worcestershire is one of those great
flavor enhancers all the other
ingredients will just taste more like
themselves
now mashed potatoes would be traditional
but I love the idea of scalloped
potatoes and I also added rutabaga to
the mix because it's winter and I have a
lot of them and rutabagas are great
they're really sweet people don't think
to use them and they're wonderful with
the potatoes and then with that savory
cheese layer them down right on top of
the meat in the same skillet and before
I add the next layer I'm gonna add some
Guerrier you could also use could use
any good melting cheese actually and
then just do it all over again add the
rest of the cheese right on top because
the cheese is what's gonna get all
golden and gooey instead of just pouring
heavy cream on this I took my cue from a
potato gratin and I reduced the cream
with garlic and thyme so that it could
absorb the flavors and then just get
thicker and richer and that is another
way to add great flavor the foil is
really important because this has to
sort of steam bake because we want the
rutabagas and the potatoes to
thrill and then I'm gonna put in Hammond
at this point my root vegetable should
be completely tender so now I'm just
gonna take the foil off and let the top
get nice and brown and there you have it
isn't it gorgeous and I cook the whole
thing in just one skillet does it even
matter what you call it this meat pie is
over the top
you
